column4: Hey, new Ubuntu setup question. I have 15.7GB of free space, I tell the setup to use that. I have WinXP on my C: drive which I want to continue using. Should I have Ubuntu make the new partition a logical or primary one?
doesn't matter
except that windows will bitch if you have more than 4 primary partitions
Can I have 2 primary partitions on a HD?
what's the difference between a primary/logical one?
yes
you don't need a seperate boot partition at all
isn't it better?
no
sudo vim /etc/whatever
How do I save after editing? ;)
:wq
be way way less vague and maybe someone will
well. . . apparently having your wireless card in the travelmate 8104 work is quite a hassle. . . as well as the sound and some other stuff.
is it too late to return it?
yes, much too late :)
why on earth are you compiling a kernel to begin with?
the forum page I linked to says that I have to get a new kernel and change it in order for my wireless card, sound and misc. buttons on my laptop to work.
help me next!! :D
all I can suggest is looking for information about it in the wiki and linux-laptop.net
I already found it. . . even linked to it. . . just can't understand it and need help with it :)
